Introduction to Word2Vec2Graph

Connecting Word2Vec Model with Graph

Posted by Melenar on September 17, 2017

Graph and Word2Vec Model

Word2Vec model maps words to vectors so we can calculate cosine similarity within pairs of words and translate pairs of words to graph: words to nodes, pairs to edges and cosine similarities to edge weights.

We are running a small AWS cluster so we will run a small text file with data about stress that was copied from Wikipedia article. We will call it Stress data file.

As Word2VecModel we will use the model that was trained on News and Wiki data about psychology. We described this model in our previous post.

Read and Clean Stress Data File

Read Wiki data file:

Tokenize Stress data file:

Remove stop words from Stress data file:

Explode Stress word arrays to words:

Exclude Words that are not in the Word2Vec Model

Read our trained Word2VecModel

Get all words from the Word2Vec model

Filter out words from Wiki data file that are not in the Word2Vec words

Create word to word matrix

Word2Vec Cosine Similarity Function

Now we want to see how words are connected with other words. We will create a function to calculate cosine similarity between vectors from the Word2Vec model

Example: Word2Vec cosine similarity between words

Cosine Similarity between Stress data file Words

Next step: calculate word to word cosine similarities and save the results.

Example: Word combinations with high Cosine Similarities:

Example: Word combinations with low Cosine Similarity:

Graph of Combinations of Stress Data File Words

Now we can build a graph using words as nodes, {word1, word2} word combinations as edges and cosine similarities between the words as edge weight

We will save graph vertices and edges in Parquet format

Load vertices and edges and rebuild the same graph

Connected Components

It's a lot of interesting things we can do with Spark GraphFrames. In this post we will play with connected components.

As we expected all word pairs are in the same large connected component.

Connected Components with High Cosine Similarity

Now we will look at connected components of subgraph with different edge weight thresholds.

Run connected components for graph with high cosine similarity
